vocabulary.definition: the process by which molecules move from an area of higher concentration to an area of lower concentration
vocabulary.example: Oxygen and carbon dioxide exchange in the body happens through diffusion.

vocabulary.definition: composed of many cells working together
vocabulary.example: Humans are multicellular organisms with specialized cells for different functions.

vocabulary.definition: the interior or inner part of something
vocabulary.example: The insides of the bacterium were filled with carbon dioxide.

vocabulary.definition: the system of pipes, tanks, fittings, and other apparatus required for the water supply, heating, and sanitation in a building
vocabulary.example: The complex plumbing in big animals ensures the circulation of nutrients and removal of waste.

vocabulary.definition: things that control or maintain a particular process
vocabulary.example: Size is one of the most important regulators of life in living organisms.

vocabulary.definition: the action or power of focusing one's attention or mental effort
vocabulary.example: The concentrations of nutrients inside the cell determine its metabolic activities.
